s.label: Sky model file(s)
s.desc: Paths to one or more sky model text files. See the documentation for a description of sky model text files.

s.label: Input FITS file(s)
s.desc: FITS file(s) to use as a sky model.

s.label: Default map units
s.desc: The physical units of pixels in the input map, if not specified in the file.

s.label: Spectral index
s.desc: The spectral index of each pixel.

s.label: Minimum fraction of peak
s.desc: The minimum allowed pixel value, as a fraction of the peak value in the image. A value of zero or less disables this filter.

s.label: Input HEALPix FITS file
s.desc: Paths to one or more HEALPix FITS files, ordered using the HEALPix RING scheme (NEST schemes are not supported).

s.label: Default map units
s.desc: The physical units of pixels in the input map, if not specified in the file.

s.label: Spectral index
s.desc: The spectral index to give to each pixel.

s.label: Coordinate system
s.desc: The spherical coordinate system used for the HEALPix representation.

s.label: Minimum fraction of peak
s.desc: The minimum allowed pixel value, as a fraction of the peak value in the image. A value of zero or less disables this filter.

s.label: Frequency [Hz]
s.desc: Frequency at which to apply the conversion from brightness temperature to Jy/pixel.

s.label: Power law index
s.desc: Power law exponent describing number per unit flux density.

s.label: Power law index 1
s.desc: Power law exponent describing number per unit flux density in region 1.

s.label: Power law index 2
s.desc: Power law exponent describing number per unit flux density in region 2.

s.label: Threshold [Jy]
Side length of grid (no. sources)
s.desc: Side length of the generated grid. A value greater than 0 will activate the grid generator.

s.label: Field-of-view [deg]
s.desc: Field-of-view spanned by the grid centre, in degrees.

s.label: Mean Stokes I flux [Jy]
s.desc: The mean of generated Stokes I fluxes, in Jy.

s.label: Standard deviation of Stokes I flux [Jy]
s.desc: The standard deviation of generated Stokes I fluxes, in Jy.

s.label: Nside
s.desc: HEALPix Nside parameter. A value greater than 0 will activate the HEALPix generator, which will produce points evenly spaced over the whole sky. The total number of points is 12 * Nside * Nside.

s.label: Amplitude
s.desc: Amplitude of generated HEALPix points, in Jy.

s.label: Override source spectral index values
s.desc: If true, override all source spectral index values using the parameters below.

s.label: Reference frequency [Hz]
s.desc: Reference frequency of all sources in the final sky model.

s.label: Spectral index mean
s.desc: Mean spectral index of all sources in the final sky model.

s.label: Spectral index std. dev.
s.desc: Standard deviation of spectral index values for all sources in the final sky model.

s.label: Random seed
s.desc: Random number generator seed used for random distributions.

s.label: Flux density min [Jy]
s.desc: Minimum flux density allowed by the filter, in Jy. Note that this filter is applied on a per-channel basis after scaling all source fluxes by the spectral index.

s.label: Flux density max [Jy]
s.desc: Maximum flux density allowed by the filter, in Jy. Note that this filter is applied on a per-channel basis after scaling all source fluxes by the spectral index.

s.label: Remove failed Gaussian sources
s.desc: If true, remove (set to zero) sources for which Gaussian width parameter solutions have failed. This can occur for sources very far from the phase centre. If false (the default), sources with failed Gaussian parameter solutions are modelled as point sources.

s.label: Apply horizon clip
s.desc: If true, clip sources below the horizon of every station at each time step. This is a benefit for all-sky models, where removing a large number of sources below the horizon can save a significant amount of time. However, to avoid a wasted check, set this to false if the sky model covers a small area which is known to be always above every station's horizon for the whole observation.

s.label: Output sky model text file
s.desc: Path used to save the final sky model as a text file (useful for debugging). Leave blank if not required.

s.label: Use named column format
s.desc: If true, save the final sky model as a text file containing a format string with named columns, compatible with LOFAR/BBS/DP3/WSClean, and described at https://www.astron.nl/lofarwiki/doku.php?id=public:user_software:documentation:makesourcedb (which can also be read by OSKAR 2.12 or later). If false, save the sky model in the fixed-column format supported by all versions of OSKAR.

s.label: Use degrees in (RA, Dec) columns
s.desc: If true, (RA, Dec) coordinate columns will be labelled "RaD" and "DecD", and values will be written in degrees, instead of having a "deg" suffix added.

s.label: Write a source name column
s.desc: If true, a source name column will be written to the file. Source names are ignored by OSKAR, and are constructed using "s" followed by a (1-based) integer index value.

s.label: Write a source type column
s.desc: If true, a source type column will be written to the file. Source types will be written as POINT or GAUSSIAN, depending on whether they have non-zero major and minor axes.
